prTitle: feat: implement homepage template with semantic structure
prBody:
## Summary

Implemented the homepage template (`task-donkey-website-feat-html-templates-2`) as part of the Donkey Education Website project. This includes both the base template foundation and the complete homepage layout.

### Changes Made

**Base Template (`src/templates/base.html`):**
- Created semantic HTML5 document structure with proper DOCTYPE and meta tags
- Implemented site header with logo and responsive navigation component
- Added mobile menu toggle with proper ARIA attributes
- Included accessibility features (skip-to-content, landmarks, ARIA labels)
- Added structured data markup for website schema
- Created semantic footer with educational content organization
- Included SVG icon sprite for scalable graphics

**Homepage Template (`src/templates/home.html`):**
- Hero section with semantic HTML and h1 heading hierarchy
- Featured breeds section using proper list markup (`<ul>` with `<li>` articles)
- Call-to-action sections using semantic `<section>` and `<article>` elements
- Care guide preview with accessible card layout
- Educational mission section with proper content structure
- Comprehensive structured data markup (JSON-LD) for SEO
- Navigation links to all main sections (/breeds/, /care/, /facts.html)
- Responsive image implementation with `<picture>` elements and srcset
- Accessibility-first design with proper ARIA labels and semantic markup

### Technical Implementation

- **Semantic HTML5**: Proper use of landmarks, headings, articles, and sections
- **Accessibility**: ARIA labels, skip links, screen reader text, keyboard navigation
- **SEO Optimization**: Meta tags, structured data, proper heading hierarchy
- **Performance**: Lazy loading, responsive images, critical CSS placeholder
- **Mobile-first**: Responsive design patterns and mobile menu functionality
- **Educational Content**: All four donkey breeds featured with proper markup

### Acceptance Criteria Met

✅ home.html extends base.html properly
✅ Hero section uses semantic HTML with h1 heading
✅ Featured breeds section uses appropriate list markup (ul/ol)
✅ Call-to-action sections use semantic article or section elements
✅ Navigation links to all main sections are present and use relative paths
✅ Structured data markup for website schema included
✅ Semantic HTML for hero content with appropriate heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3)
✅ Featured breeds carousel sections implemented

Closes #18
